TO: MSB Board of Directors
FROM: Harold E. Hill
DATE: June 3, 1962
rIhe luncheon period on the first day of our convention this fall has been set aside for
the directors to meet -with their constituents. (You will recall that we are trying a new
format this year whereby the Board will meet on Sunday, ahead of the convention, hut Trill
only discuss, and not vote on, issues which they would like to take up with their members.
Then the Board will meet again on Thursday, the day following the convention, to dispose
of such matters.)
The period from 12:15 to 2:45 is available to you to hold your meetings (which will be, •
in effect. Regional business meetings), and you may include luncheon or not, as you deem
advisable. You may prefer to let your people eat "on their own" and not start your meet¬
ing until, say, 1:00 p.m., or you may wish to have a luncheon meeting. We have reserved
meeting rooms at the hotel for your use in this regard, and, if you decide to hold a luncheon
meeting, we will arrange with the hotel to serve the same luncheon to all of the groups
desiring it*
We presume that the Radio and TV Director of each region will confer to work out details
of their own meeting. In addition, if Christiansen and weld would like to hoia a separate
meeting for Associate members, and Skoraia would like to hold a separate meeting for Indivi¬
dual members, space can be provided for that, too. However, the latter three may decide
that it would be preferable to have the Associates and/or Individual members meet with
their respective regions, or not at all.
33ie Directors will be responsible for notifying their constituents and for planning their
own meetings. However, if you would like for notices to be sent out from the mailing center
in Urbaca, we will be happy to do this fox'* you if you will send the copy to the UTbana
office. And, as indicated, if you want to have a luncheon, we will make the food arrange¬
ments with the hotel.
In order for the staff to plan properly, there is certain information We will need fairly
soon. Therefore, will you please let m know not later than July 1 whether or not you want
to include a luncheon (each member to pay for his own meal, of course) arid you best estimate
as to how many you might expect at the meeting. Veld, Christiansen and Skomia should let
me know whether or not they want to hold meetings and, if so, the same information about
luncheon and number expected.
Then, not later than September 1, I will need a firm figure as to how many you will expect.
This may be merely a more educated estimate if you do not plan a meal, but needs to be
fairly accurate if you do intend to have the luncheon because we will have to tell the
hotel how many meals to plan on.
